title.narrative: OUTPUT 3.1 EDUCATION SYSTEM

description.narrative: Output 3.1: National education system in Yemen is better equipped to provide and promote improved access to basic quality education services, including humanitarian response and early recovery, for most vulnerable children, girls and adolescents, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, sustained quality access for girls and boys to equitable and inclusive education opportunities

participating-org.narrative: EDUCATION TECHNICAL OFFICE MINISTRY OF EDUCATION

sector.narrative: System strengthening - Education management information system (does not include learning assessment system)
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 3.1: National education system in Yemen is better equipped to provide and promote improved access to basic qualityeducation services, including humanitarian response and early recovery, for most vulnerable children, girls and adolescents

description.narrative: In 2021, UNICEF’s efforts contributed to the strengthening of capacities for effective education sector policy development, and data collection and analysis. Key knowledge products that will contribute to the enhancement of the evidence base were initiated (Youth and Adolescent, Out of School Children Study) and the implementation of the EMIS Strategic Roadmap continued through 2021. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/01/2022
